page.title: Nominal Phrases - Agreement
page.introduction: Many languages require agreement between at least some of the modifiers and the head noun. While English only has number agreement, in other languages this agreement may also include animacy, class, or gender.

The grammar rules generated by this starter kit include the constraints for full agreement, but if your language only has partial or no agreement, you simply will not add those features to your lexical items. In that case, the constraints will only apply vacuously. Based on your answers below about the agreement system in your language, you will be instructed to add the appropriate features in the sections that follow.

For number agreement, languages may have agreement between the head noun and some of its modifiers. This is the case for English, which has singular and plural forms for nouns and demonstratives which must agree, as in this new book and these new books. Note that the form of the adjective does not change. Numbers and quantifiers also must agree with either the singular or plural form of the noun as appropriate.
Spanish is an example of a language with full number agreement between the noun and all of its modifiers, as in un libro nuevo ‘a new book’ and algunos libros nuevos ‘some new books’.
Some Zapotec languages do not have any number agreement. There is only one form for nouns and all modifiers which can be used for either singular or plural. The only way to clearly signal the number feature of a nominal phrase is to use numbers or other quantifiers, as in ngyed gol ‘old chicken/chickens’ versus te ngyed gol ‘one old chicken’ and ndal ngyed gol ‘lots of old chickens’.

form.introduction:
In addition to the number feature, nouns may be marked with other features, such as class number or type, gender, or animacy, which some or all noun modifiers need to agree with.
An example of Bantu class number agreement is Ba-shányana bá-ne ‘2-boys 2-DEM’ ‘those boys’.
Examples of gender agreement in Spanish are: el hombre viejo ‘the old man’ and la mujer vieja ‘the old woman’.
Chinantec has animacy agreement, as in e ta'ˊe néeˉ ‘the.INAN honey.INAN REL.INAN yellow.INAN’ ‘the yellow honey’ and i ̱ta'ˊ i ̱ neáangˉ ‘he.AN bee.AN REL.AN yellow.AN’ ‘the yellow bee’.
